title: Igor's kindle python scripts AZW  mobi hack

Igor Skochinsky found that AmazonÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s AZW files are actually Mobi files, but Amazon didnÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢t share KindleÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Mobi PID which would allow one to buy encrypted Mobi books for Kindle.He discovered the algorithm used to generate the PID and was able to use it on Fictionwise, but there was another catch. AZW files have a flag set in the DRM info which is not present in books bought from other vendors. After fixing that, he could read the book on Kindle.

this torrent includes two Python scripts.

kindlepid.py generates Mobi PID from Kindle serial number. You can then add this PID at a Mobipocket vendor site and redownload books with KindleÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s PID enabled. ItÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s possible that some vendors will refuse this PID, as it has an asterisk in place of the traditional dollar sign (Fictionwise works fine).

kindlefix.py ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã…â€œfixesÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚ï¿½ a Mobi book so that it can be read on Kindle. It should already include KindleÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s PID (which you need to specify too). The script will output the fixed book with .azw extension.
